alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 17 at 10:42PM EDT until March 19 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Marlboro and Chesterfield Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pee Dee River At Cheraw. * WHEN...From late tonight to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, River bottomland downstream from cheraw will begin to flood. At 30.0 feet, The higher bank begins to flood. Large areas of farmland and river bottomland near Cheraw will be flooded. Portions of Riverside Park become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 29.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 30.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1000 AM EDT.
